OpenTelemetry.CspConnectSrcDescription: Set Content Security Policy to allow Matomo connect to a OTEL collector, like http://127.0.0.1:4318 or https://myendpoint:443
OpenTelemetry.EnableDocumentLoadMonitoringDescription: Covers much of the instance usage, including page load times.
OpenTelemetry.EnableUserInteractionMonitoringDescripti: Tracks user behaviours, such as clicking links.
OpenTelemetry.EnableUxMonitoringDescription: Basic UX monitoring. If you are already using document load monitoring, this may not be necessary.
OpenTelemetry.EnableWebVitalsDescription: Collects LCP, INP and CLS Web Vitals, and, when supported by the browser, tasks longer than 50 ms (long tasks).
OpenTelemetry.OtelEndpointDescription: The full URL to which OpenTelemetry data is sent, for example `https://myhost.org:4318/v1/traces` or `https://myhost.org`. Normally, an HTTP endpoint is required.
OpenTelemetry.ServiceNameDescription: The name of the service used to identify the browser (client) in OpenTelemetry. Do not use the same name as the backend (PHP), as this may cause issues.
OpenTelemetry.ResourceAttributesDescription: Resource attributes to add to all traces, like: host.name=matomo.loc
